short_summary: Collection of biological samples and measurements of percent coverage of biofouling organisms on commercial ships
description: Biofouling is the process by which organisms accumulate on surfaces submerged in water, such as ship hulls. This phenomenon can have significant ecological and economic impacts, as it can facilitate the spread of non-native species, alter marine ecosystems, and increase fuel consumption and emissions of ships.
full_summary:
**Title:** Collection and Estimation of Underwater Biofouling of Commercial Vessels

**Reference Number:** cb-915-53200138
**Solicitation Number:** 30005532

**Notice Publication Date:** 2024-02-16
**Tender Closing Date:** 2024-03-05T14:00:00

**Notice Type:** Request for Proposal

**Procurement Category:** Supply and Service (SRV)

**Objective:**
The objective of this contract is to obtain technical diving services to collect underwater video, photos, and physical scrapings of biofouling organisms on commercial ships in high-traffic Canadian ports on the Great Lakes.

**Scope of Work:**
The scope of work includes collecting biological samples and measuring percent coverage of fouling organisms on the vessel hull and niche areas of commercial ships. The work will be completed within the Hamilton-Oshawa Port Authority ports (Hamilton, Oshawa, and Thorold, ON).

**Technical Requirements:**
The contractor shall provide a surface-supplied dive team, capable of completing the dive setup, ship lockout, survey, and sample collection within approximately 8 hours. The contractor shall also provide all necessary diving and safety equipment.

**Contract Period:**
The contract period will be from the date of contract award to March 31, 2025, with an option to extend for an additional one year.

**Security Requirements:**
No security clearance is required, but an escort is necessary at DFO sites.

**Intellectual Property:**
The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada retains all intellectual property rights arising from the performance of the work.

**Trade Agreements:**
This procurement is subject to several international trade agreements, including the Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement, the CPTPP, and the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement.

**Contact Information:**
For more information, please contact Mazen Obeid at (613) 299-2564 or email mazen.obeid@dfo-mpo.gc.ca.

**Notice URL:**
https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/32192/30005532---rfp.pdf (English)
